newsitem.title: INDIA: India 10-yr bond cut-off seen at 13.0-13.15 pct.
newsitem.headline: India 10-yr bond cut-off seen at 13.0-13.15 pct.

text.p: The cut-off yield at the first 10-year bond auction for 1997/98 (April-March) is likely to be between 13.0 and 13.15 percent, ICICI Securities and Finance Co (I-Sec) said in a report on Monday.
The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) auctions 30 billion rupees of 10-year bonds later on Monday.

"Full subscription for the notified amount of 30 billion rupees is certain and the cut-off yield is likely to be in the region of 13.0 and 13.15 percent, though a decline below these levels is less likely," I-Sec said.
The report said secondary market yields on long-maturity securities have come down sharply to around 13 percent from 14 percent levels in March 1996.

"The last four to six weeks have seen a near vertical drop in yields on the long bond to 13 percent from 13.60 percent," it said. "Deals have also been struck at sub-13 percent yields but volumes at these levels have been very thin."
I-Sec said bidding at the auction was likely to be high, given a large liquidity surplus in the banking system.
